business.headline: PM's Diwali gift delivered: Nirmala Sitharaman presents GST 2.0 report cardGST Bachat Utsav: Sitharaman, addressing a press conference along with ministers Piyush Goyal and Ashwini Vaishnaw ahead of Diwali, said the GST rate cuts resulted in bumper sales of cars and electronics.

Gold prices near record high on Dhanteras: Should you buy?Gold prices have been on a relentless rally, hitting new record highs almost every day. But does this glittering streak make it the right fit for your investment portfolio this Dhanteras?

Gold flashing a big warning signal: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu says amid rising pricesAs gold prices soar globally, Zoho's Sridhar Vembu raises a red flag. Does the surge signal investor anxiety and eroding trust in the system or reveal a deeper economic fault line?

Gold prices hit record high ahead of Dhanteras, see Rs 3,200 hike in DelhiTraders said gold buying activity picked up sharply as stockists built fresh positions on expectations of higher sales during the festive season.

Why silver utensils, not coins, could help make more moneyWith the price of silver at a record high, silverware might be a potential tax-saving alternative to bars and coins. Personal-use silver utensils are exempt from capital gains tax when sold. Here's what chartered accountants have to say about silver utensils helping investors save on taxes.
Sensex ends 484 points higher, Nifty above 25,700; Asian Paints jumps 4%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 484.53 points higher at 83,952.19, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 124.55 points to close at 25,709.85.

Diwali 2025: From ETFs to SGBs, 5 smart ways to invest in goldWith gold prices at record levels this Diwali, many people are rethinking whether to buy jewellery or look at smarter investment routes. From gold ETFs to SGBs, there are safer and more practical ways to invest without worrying about storage or high-making charges.

Coca-Cola eyes $1 billion IPO for Indian bottling arm: ReportThe discussions are still in early stages, and Coca-Cola has not yet appointed bankers for the deal. The listing could take place as early as next year, though details such as timing, structure, and offer size are still being worked out, the report said.

Why keeping all your money in saving account may be a costly mistake, explains CAMany people believe that money parked in a savings account is the safest option. But an expert warns that this habit could quietly drain your wealth over time, especially when inflation eats into low returns.
EPFO rule change: What's new in PF withdrawals and how it affects youConfused about the new EPFO rules? This guide covers every update, from withdrawal limits to pension changes, in one place.

Dhanteras 2025: Know gold and silver rates in your city before you buyDhanteras is a day when many Indian families choose to bring home gold or silver, believing it invites prosperity and good fortune. From jewellery and coins to small utensils, shoppers often plan their purchases in advance. But with prices running high this season, checking the latest rates in your city has become more important than ever.

Diwali 2025: Planning to buy or gift gold? Know the tax rules firstFrom coins to jewellery, gold remains a favourite Diwali buy. However, not everyone realises that certain tax rules apply when you purchase or gift gold. Knowing these in advance can help you avoid unexpected trouble later.

Sensex surges 700 points: What is the stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 647.53 points to 94,115.19 around 11:30 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 182.35 points to trade at 25,767.65. Most broader market indices also advanced, though volatility remained elevated.

Buying just gold on Dhanteras? Why you should consider a mutual fund SIPAs Dhanteras's theme shifts from gold to goal-based investing, here is a detailed guide to help investors make smarter, purpose-driven financial choices this festive season.

Big bullion days: Why are gold and silver reaching record highs every day?In India, the timing for the gold and silver rally could not have been more interesting, as the surge comes just ahead of Dhanteras, when buying gold is considered auspicious.

Gold at Rs 1.3 lakh, silver doubles: Is it safe to invest this Diwali?With prices soaring to record highs, the question everyone is asking is whether this Diwali is the right time to buy or if investors are chasing a fleeting festive rally.

Wipro shares plunge nearly 5% despite rise in Q2 net profit. Here's whyAt around 9:30 am, Wipro was trading at Rs 242.12 on the NSE, down 4.6%. The Nifty IT index slipped around 1.2%, weighed down by losses in both Wipro and Infosys.

Sensex, Nifty open lower amid cautious trade; Asian Paints jumps over 3%At around 9:20 am, the S&P BSE Sensex slipped 112.93 points to 83,354.73, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.45 points at 25,542.85.

IMF chief says open trade key for India's continued economic riseIMF Director Kristalina Georgieva said that India stands out as one of the fastest-growing economies in the world and continues to make a major contribution to global growth because of its consistent reform efforts.

entertainment.headline: AP Dhillon shares why he stays away from Bollywood's music industry Singer AP Dhillon has criticised current industry practices, claiming Bollywood exploits Punjabi artists for profit. He stresses the importance of solidarity among senior Punjabi artists to prevent exploitation of younger talent.

30 years after DDLJ: How patriarchal fathers still rule Bollywood Even 30 years after 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', Bollywood continues to show fathers who control their daughters' marriage choices, reflecting persistent patriarchal norms. Later films like 'Kabir Singh' and '2 States' highlight how toxic fatherhood still influences women's autonomy in love and marriage on screen.

Puneet Issar's moving tribute to Pankaj Dheer: Our bond was stronger than brothers Veteran actor Pankaj Dheer, famed for portraying Karna in 'Mahabharat', died in Mumbai on October 15, 2025 at 68 after battling cancer.  Puneet Issar, his close friend and co-star, shared heartfelt memories and quoted lines from the Mahabharata in tribute.

Limp Bizkit bassist Sam Rivers dies at 48, band pays tribute to his legacy Metal band Limp Bizkit bassist Sam Rivers has died at the age of 48, as announced by the band on social media. Rivers had significant health challenges, including liver disease and a transplant in 2017.

Empty seats, long wait at India debut: Fan posts say Travis Scott won't come back Rapper Travis Scott's India debut in Delhi received mixed reviews, with reports of empty seats and delays. Over 3,400 personnel were assigned for security, aiming for a smooth experience for attendees.

Anupam Kher says he manages brother Raju's finances, praises wife Kirron Actor Anupam Kher has spoken publicly about taking care of his brother Raju Kher's finances.  He has praised his wife, Kirron Kher, for never questioning his supportive decisions.

Inside Mr Scorsese: The documentary revealing the filmmaker we never truly knew The new documentary series 'Mr. Scorsese' unveils the filmmaker behind the myth — a man torn between faith and fury, guilt and genius, who turned his search for moral truth into one of the most profound cinematic journeys ever made.

BB19 Episode 55: Amaal Mallik cries as Salman, father Dabboo Mallik scold him Actor Salman Khan reprimanded Amaal Mallik on 'Bigg Boss 19' for using derogatory language against Farhana Bhatt. The episode saw emotional moments as Dabboo Mallik scolded his son, highlighting tensions in the house.

Travis Scott lights up Delhi crowd with Goosebumps, Sicko Mode and pure madness American rapper Travis Scott set Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru (JLN) Stadium ablaze with an electrifying concert. The high-energy show sparked excitement among fans, with many trying to breach the security at the mega event.

Ayushmann, Sharvari to begin shoot for Sooraj Barjatya's film in November: Report Ayushmann Khurrana and Sharvari will start shooting a new family entertainer directed by Sooraj Barjatya in November 2025. The collaboration signals another promising project following the success of 'Uunchai' and highlights Mahaveer Jain's expanding production ventures.

Lee Jung-jae shares selfie with SRK, expresses gratitude on meeting Bollywood icon Actor Lee Jung-jae shared a selfie with Shah Rukh Khan, expressing his admiration. The meeting excited fans who praised both actors as legends in their fields.

Mom-to-be Parineeti Chopra in Delhi ahead of delivery of first child: Report Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha prepare to welcome their first child as the 'Amar Singh Chamkila' actor nears the final stage of pregnancy. The duo had confirmed about the pregnancy in a social media post a while ago.

Salman brings whole family in new post for clothing line; Malaika, Seema feature too Salman Khan celebrated 12 years of his clothing brand with a gratitude note. His post highlights close family ties with Malaika Arora and Seema Sajdeh.

Dolly Singh becomes first Indian to win Instagram Golden Ring, calls it surreal Actor-influencer Dolly Singh has made history as the first Indian to win Instagram's Global 2025 Rings Award. This milestone recognises her bold creativity and influence on digital culture.

Mahabharat Ek Dharmayudh: An AI powered series on India's greatest mystical epic The AI-powered mystical series 'Mahabharat: Ek Dharmayudh', merges timeless Indian epic storytelling with cutting-edge technology, offering a new immersive viewing experience.

Rajat Bedi on daughter Vera's reaction to comparisons with Kareena, Aishwarya Actor Rajat Bedi's daughter Vera was compared to Kareena Kapoor Khan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan after her viral appearance at 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiere. He reacted to the unexpected attention on Vera.

K-Ramp review: Kiran Abbavaram's comedy forgets sensitivity, logic, even humourRelease Date:Sat Oct 18, 2025 'K-Ramp' aims to be a loud, full-on comedy with emotional undertones, but it ends up confused, insensitive, and tone-deaf.

Ranveer Singh, Sreeleela team up in Rs 150 crore ad; Jawan fame Atlee directs Actor Ranveer Singh returns in an action-themed Ching's advert directed by Atlee, co-starring Sreeleela and Bobby Deol. With a reported budget of Rs 150 crore, the campaign surpasses several Bollywood films in scale.

She'll make you dance: Shabana Azmi's sweet warning to new father Arbaaz Khan Actor Arbaaz Khan and his wife Sshura welcomed their daughter, Sipaara, on October 5. Actor Shabana Azmi congratulated Arbaaz Khan and shared a good-natured warning about fatherhood.

general news.headline: Sunday ruined: Virat Kohli out for 0, Rohit Sharma flops on ODI comebacks in PerthIndia tour of Australia: The much-anticipated ODI comebacks of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma didn't go as planned. Former captain Rohit managed just 8 runs, while Kohli fell for a duck after Australia opted to bowl in the series opener in Perth on Sunday, October 19.

25,000 Americans would die, says Trump as US bombs 'drug-carrying submarine'A video posted by the Pentagon on X showed black-and-white footage of the strike. In the clip, the semi-submersible vessel could be seen gliding through the waves with its front portion submerged just below the surface before a series of explosions struck, one detonating over the vessel's rear.

Pakistan, Afghanistan agree to immediate ceasefire during Doha talks, says QatarPakistan and Afghanistan agreed to an immediate ceasefire during Doha talks mediated by Qatar and Turkey, aiming to halt border violence, hold follow-up meetings, and ensure long-term stability along the border.

1st ODI Live: Rain returns in Perth, further delay expectedIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS) Live Score, 1st ODI: A big rain delay is expected in Perth as rain keeps pelting down at the Optus Stadium. India have had a precarious start to their Australia tour where both Rohit and Kohli have failed in the opening ODI.

How a coconut crisis is making your nariyal chutney runnyCoconut prices have exploded across India, leaving households and hawkers equally stunned. The coconut crisis is reflected in crispy banana chips to everyday curries and chutneys. What's causing this steep surge, and how long will the naryial crunch last?

Pollution grips Delhi ahead of Diwali as some parts record air quality above 400Delhi's air quality remains very poor for the sixth day, with areas like Akshardham and Anand Vihar seeing severe pollution levels.

Trump posts AI video of himself in KING TRUMP jet, bombing protesters with liquidThe clip, shared on both his personal and official social media accounts, shows Trump flying a fighter jet labelled "KING TRUMP" above what appears to be Times Square, dumping brown liquid on demonstrators as Kenny Loggins' 'Danger Zone' blares, a clear nod to the Top Gun films.

Jain community's bulk buy bonanza: 190 luxury cars, Rs 21.5 crore in savingsAlthough these cars were bought in a nationwide drive, the majority of the buyers hailed from Gujarat's Ahmedabad. As per sources, 30 of the 190 cars were purchased by members of the trade organisation living in Gujarat.

Credible report: US claims Hamas planning attack on Gaza civilians, vows actionThe United States has warned of an imminent Hamas attack on Gaza, citing credible intelligence of a possible ceasefire violation. Washington urged Hamas to uphold the peace agreement brokered by Donald Trump.

Akhilesh Yadav suggests not to spend money on diyas, candles; Hindu outfit reactsSamajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav faced backlash from the VHP after suggesting that the UP government should avoid "wasting money" on Diwali diyas, drawing parallels with Christmas celebrations.

Rahul Gandhi's, Tejashwi Yadav's arrogance: BJP on JMM exiting MahagathbandhanThe BJP seized on JMM's decision to quit the Bihar Mahagathbandhan, blaming the "arrogance" of Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav for the alliance's collapse. The rift deepens cracks within the opposition bloc already battling infighting ahead of the November polls.

From London to Washington, 'No Kings' protests challenge Trump's sweeping policiesThousands of people participated in the worldwide 'No Kings' protests against US President Donald Trump's immigration, education and security policies, with organisers warning of an authoritarian drift in Washington.

Siddaramaiah cautions against RSS, urges avoiding Sanatanis. Then, he clarifiesEarlier on Saturday, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah alleged that the RSS and Sangh Parivar had opposed BR Ambedkar's Constitution and continue to do so, urging people to remain vigilant.

Satwik-Chirag's magical run in Denmark Open ends with semi-final exitSatwik-Chirag's magical run in the Denmark Open came to an end on Saturday, October 18 as lost to Japan's Takuro Hoki and Yugo Kobayashi in a three-game thriller. The Indian duo bounced back after losing the first game but ultimately went down fighting.

Rishad Hossain's historic spell sinks West Indies as Bangladesh take 1-0 leadBAN vs WI: Bangladesh took a 1-0 lead in the series against the West Indies after winning the opening game by 74 runs at the Sher-e-Bangla National Stadium in Mirpur. Rishad Hossain scored 26 runs and picked up a six-wicket haul.

Mohun Bagan beat East Bengal in shootout to claim first IFA Shield title in 22 yearsMohun Bagan Super Giant overcame arch-rivals East Bengal 5-4 on penalties after a 1-1 draw in the 125th IFA Shield final at Salt Lake Stadium, bringing home their 21st title and ending a 22-year wait.

Pakistan-Afghanistan Conflict: India's BCCI Slams Pak Airstrike That Killed 3 Young Afghan PlayersThis special report covers the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) condoling the tragic loss of three young Afghan cricketers, Kabir Agha, Sigbhutullah, and Haroon, in Paktika province. The players were killed in what the transcript describes as a 'cowardly cross-border airstrike'. The BCCI stated, 'We stand in solidarity with the Afghanistan Cricket Board, the cricket fraternity and the families of the departed players'. The report also notes the significant fallout from the incident, with the Afghanistan Cricket Board deciding to withdraw from a planned tri-nation T20I series that was to include Pakistan and Sri Lanka. The BCCI's statement expressed deep sorrow, highlighting that the loss of promising sportspersons is a matter of great concern and shared its sympathies with the people of Afghanistan during this difficult time.

Pakistan-Afghanistan Conflict: India's BCCI Slams Pak Airstrike That Killed 3 Young Afghan PlayersThis special report covers the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) condoling the tragic loss of three young Afghan cricketers, Kabir Agha, Sigbhutullah, and Haroon, in Paktika province. Yuvraj Singh sends out condolences to Paktika victims: Our thoughts are with themFormer Indian cricketer Yuvraj Singh extended condolences to the families of three Afghan cricketers killed in a Pakistani airstrike in Paktika, highlighting the global cricket community's grief.

Ro-Ko should play domestic cricket, hope they be in 2027 World Cup: Ex-IND spinnerFormer India spinner Amit Mishra said that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli should play domestic cricket in a bid to keep themselves ready for the 2027 World Cup. Rohit and Kohli are making a return to the Indian team after the Champions Trophy.

BCCI and ICC condemn deadly Pak airstrike that killed 3 Afghan cricketersBoth the BCCI and the ICC have released separate statements which condemn the recent airstrike that took place in Afghanistan's Paktika province which claimed the lives of three young Afghan cricketers.

Nottingham Forest sack Ange Postecoglou moments after Chelsea thrashingNottingham Forest have sacked manager Ange Postecoglou following their 0-3 loss to Chelsea on Sunday, October 18. Postecoglou failed to win any of his games in charge of the club as they edge closer to relegation.

Watch: Ellyse Perry gets trendy new hairstyle from local Vizag girlEllyse Perry showcased her fun side at the Women's World Cup 2025, getting a stylish new hairstyle from a local girl in Visakhapatnam. Earlier, Perry's unbeaten 47 helped Australia to a record-breaking chase against India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
